Benchmark: Sustain narration and description in past, present, and future time; support opinions and hypothesize.
Participate in paragraph‑length conversation about events, experiences, and some academic topics; handle complications.
Participate in conversations, often in paragraph‑length turns, on familiar topics and some concrete social issues.
Ask and answer a variety of questions; participate in simple conversations on familiar topics. ​
Handle short social interactions in everyday situations by asking and answering a variety of questions. ​
Ask and answer simple questions; handle short social interactions with some repetition and support. ​
Use isolated words, memorized phrases, and simple learned questions/answers on very familiar topics. ​
Understand main ideas and most details of connected texts on familiar and some unfamiliar topics; follow arguments.
Understand main ideas and some implicit information in a variety of familiar and some unfamiliar texts.
Understand main ideas and some supporting details in simple, connected texts on familiar topics.
Understand main ideas and many details in simple texts on familiar and everyday topics; begin to follow short narratives.
Understand main ideas in short, highly predictable oral or written texts on familiar topics supported by visuals.
Understand words, phrases, and memorized expressions in highly predictable texts with strong visual support.
Present organized, paragraph‑length speeches or texts to narrate, explain, or persuade on familiar topics.
Present information and narrate about events and experiences in paragraph‑length discourse.
Produce simple connected sentences in a series to describe, narrate, or give basic information. ​
Present information in connected sentences about familiar topics, with some organization and detail.
Produce simple sentences, often using memorized chunks, about familiar topics. ​
Copy or produce lists, labels, and simple memorized phrases. ​
